tag.name: cfabort
tag.help: Stops the processing of a CFML page at the tag location. CFML returns everything that was processed before the tag. The tag is often used with conditional logic to stop processing a page when a condition occurs.

parameter.name: showerror
parameter.help: Error to display, in a standard CFML error page, when tag executes

parameter.name: attributecollection
parameter.help: You can specify this tag's attributes in an attributeCollection whose value is a structure. Specify the structure name in the attributeCollection and use the tag’s attribute names as structure keys.

tag.name: cfapplet
tag.help: This tag references a registered custom Java applet. To register a Java applet, in the CFML Administrator, click Extensions/Java Applets. Using this tag within a cfform tag is optional. If you use it within cfform, and the method attribute is defined in the Administrator, the return value is incorporated into the form.

parameter.name: appletsource
parameter.help: Name of registered applet

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Form variable name for applet

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Control's height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Control's width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cfapplication
tag.help: Defines the scope of a CFML application; enables and disables storage of Client variables; specifies the Client variable storage mechanism; enables Session variables; and sets Application variable timeouts.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of application. Up to 64 characters

parameter.name: loginstorage
parameter.help: cookie: store login information in the Cookie scope. session: store login information in the Session scope.

parameter.name: clientmanagement
parameter.help: enables client variables

parameter.name: clientstorage
parameter.help: How client variables are stored * datasource_name: in ODBC or native data source. You must create storage repository in the Administrator. * registry: in the system registry. * cookie: on client computer in a cookie. Scalable. If client disables cookies in the browser, client variables do not work

parameter.name: setclientcookies
parameter.help: No: CFML does not automatically send CFID and CFTOKEN cookies to client browser; you must manually code CFID and CFTOKEN on the URL for every page that uses Session or Client variables

parameter.name: sessionmanagement
parameter.help: enables session variables

parameter.name: sessiontimeout
parameter.help: Lifespan of session variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas

parameter.name: applicationtimeout
parameter.help: Lifespan of application variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas.

parameter.name: setdomaincookies
parameter.help: Yes: Sets CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not a host) Required, for applications running on clusters.

parameter.name: scriptprotect
parameter.help: Specifies whether to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks. - none: do not protect variables - all: protect Form, URL, CGI, and Cookie variables - comma-delimited list of ColdFusion scopes: protect variables in the specified scopes

parameter.name: securejsonprefix
parameter.help: The security prefix to put in front of the value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format in response to a remote call if the secureJSON setting is true.

parameter.name: securejson
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to add a security prefix in front of any value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format in response to a remote call.

parameter.name: serverSideFormValidation
parameter.help: Enable/Disable ColdFusion’s server side validation on CFFORM.

tag.name: cfargument
tag.help: Creates a parameter definition within a component definition. Defines a function argument. Used within a cffunction tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: An argument name.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: a type name; data type of the argument.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Whether the parameter is required to execute the component method.

parameter.name: default
parameter.help: If no argument is passed, specifies a default argument value.

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value follows the displayname attribute value in the parameter description line. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter

tag.name: cfassociate
tag.help: Allows subtag data to be saved with a base tag. Applies only to custom tags.

parameter.name: basetag
parameter.help: Base tag name

parameter.name: datacollection
parameter.help: Structure in which base tag stores subtag data

tag.name: cfbreak
tag.help: Used within a cfloop tag. Breaks out of a loop.

tag.name: cfcache
tag.help:
Stores a copy of a page on the server and/or client computer, to improve page rendering performance. To do this, the tag creates temporary files that contain the static HTML returned from a CFML page.
Use this tag if it is not necessary to get dynamic content each time a user accesses a page. You can use this tag for simple URLs and for URLs that contain URL parameters.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: * cache: server-side and client-side caching. * flush: refresh cached page(s). * clientcache: browser-side caching only. To cache a personalized page, use this option. * servercache: server-side caching only. Not recommended. * optimal: same as "cache".

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Absolute path of cache directory.

parameter.name: timespan
parameter.help: The interval until the page is flushed from the cache.

parameter.name: expireurl
parameter.help: Used with action = "flush". A URL reference. CFML matches it against the mappings in the specified cache directory. Can include wildcards. For example: "*/view.cfm?id=*".

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: A username

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: A password

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Remote port to which to connect

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Protocol that is used to create URL from cache.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: For action="set", object which needs to be stored

parameter.name: metadata
parameter.help: Name of the struct variable

parameter.name: stripwhitespace
parameter.help: Reduces whitespace

parameter.name: throwonerror
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether t throw an error if the flush action encounters an error. Otherwise the action does not generate an error if it fails. If this attribute is true you can handle the error in a cfcatch block, for example, if a specified id value is invalid

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: Id of the cached object

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: key to access cache

parameter.name: usecache
parameter.help: to use cache or not (if false it will process the content each time)

parameter.name: dependson
parameter.help: Comma seperated list of all variables on which this cache would depend

parameter.name: idletime
parameter.help: Flushes the cached item if it is not accessed for the specified time span.

parameter.name: cachedirectory
parameter.help: Cache directory

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: name of return variable, valid with action="get"

function.name: abs
function.help: Absolute-value function. The absolute value of a number is the number without its sign.

function.name: acos
function.help: Returns the angle whose cosine is the value passed as the argument.

parameter.name: number
parameter.help: The value to be converted into an angle. Must be between -1 and 1.

function.name: ajaxLink
function.help: Causes an HTML href attribute to display link results in the current Ajax container.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: The URL of the link.

function.name: ajaxOnLoad
function.help: Causes the specified JavaScript function to run when the page loads.

parameter.name: functionname
parameter.help: The name of the function to run when the page loads.

function.name: arrayContains
function.help: Returns true if specified object is present is given array

function.name: arrayDelete
function.help: Deletes specified object from given array

function.name: arrayMax
function.help: Returns the largest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

function.name: arrayMin
function.help: Returns the smallest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

function.name: arraylen
function.help: Determines the number of elements in an array. CFML MX: this function can be used on child XML objects.

function.name: arrayAppend
function.help: Appends an array element to an array.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: The array to which the element should be appended.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The element to append. Can be any type.

function.name: arrayAvg
function.help: Calculates the average of the values in an array. All elements in the array must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric.

function.name: arrayClear
function.help: Removes all elements from an array.

function.name: arrayNew
function.help: Creates an array of 1-3 dimensions. Index array elements with square brackets: [ ]. CFML arrays expand dynamically as data is added.

function.name: arrayPrepend
function.help: Inserts an array element at the beginning of an array and shifts the positions of the existing elements to make room.

function.name: arrayResize
function.help: Resets an array to a specified minimum number of elements. This can improve performance, if used to size an array to its expected maximum. For more than 500 elements, use ArrayResize immediately after using the ArrayNew tag.

function.name: arraySet
function.help: In a one-dimensional array, sets the elements in a specified index range to a value. Useful for initializing an array after a call to ArrayNew.

function.name: arraySort
function.help: Sorts array elements numerically or alphanumerically.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: Name of an array

parameter.name: sort_type
parameter.help:
numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account (also known as case sensitive). All letters of one case precede the first letter of the other case: - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" (ascending sort) - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" (descending sort)
textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case (also known as case-insensitive). A letter in varying cases precedes the next letter: - aAaBbBzzZ, in an ascending sort; preserves original intra-letter order - ZzzBbBaAa, in a descending sort; reverses original intra-letter order

parameter.name: sort_order
parameter.help:
asc: ascending sort order. Default. - aabzABZ or aAaBbBzzZ, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from smaller to larger, for numbers
desc: descending sort order. - ZBAzbaa or ZzzBbBaAa, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from larger to smaller, for numbers

scopevar.name: Client
scopevar.help: Client scope variables

scopevar.name: AUTH_TYPE
scopevar.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, the protocol-specific authentication method used to validate the user.

scopevar.name: AUTH_USER
scopevar.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, the username the user has authenticated as. (Also available as AUTH_USER.)

scopevar.name: CERT_ISSUER
scopevar.help: Information about the authority that provided the client certificate

scopevar.name: CERT_SUBJECT
scopevar.help: Client-specific information provided by the web server. This data typically includes the client's name, e-mail address, and so on

scopevar.name: CONTENT_LENGTH
scopevar.help: Length of the content as given by the client.

scopevar.name: CONTENT_TYPE
scopevar.help: For queries that have attached information, such as HTTP POST and PUT, this is the content type of the data.

scopevar.name: GATEWAY_INTERFACE
scopevar.help: CGI specification revision with which this server complies. Format: CGI/revision.

scopevar.name: HTTP_REFERER
scopevar.help: The referring document that linked to or submitted form data.

scopevar.name: HTTP_USER_AGENT
scopevar.help: The browser that the client is currently using to send the request. Format: software/version library/version.

scopevar.name: QUERY_STRING
scopevar.help: Query information that follows the ? in the URL that referenced this script.

scopevar.name: REMOTE_ADDR
scopevar.help: IP address of the remote host making the request.

scopevar.name: REMOTE_HOST
scopevar.help: Hostname making the request. If the server does not have this information, it sets REMOTE_ADDR and does not set REMOTE_HOST.

scopevar.name: REMOTE_USER
scopevar.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, the username the user has authenticated as. (Also available as AUTH_USER.)

scopevar.name: REQUEST_METHOD
scopevar.help: Method with which the request was made. For HTTP, this is Get, Head, Post, and so on.

scopevar.name: SCRIPT_NAME
scopevar.help: Virtual path to the script that is executing; used for self-referencing URLs.

scopevar.name: SERVER_NAME
scopevar.help: Server's hostname, DNS alias, or IP address as it appears in self-referencing URLs.

scopevar.name: SERVER_PORT
scopevar.help: Port number to which the request was sent.

scopevar.name: SERVER_PROTOCOL
scopevar.help: Name and revision of the information protocol this request came in with. Format: protocol/revision.

scopevar.name: SERVER_SOFTWARE
scopevar.help: Name and version of the information server software answering the request (and running the gateway). Format: name/version.

scopevar.name: Server
scopevar.help: Client scope variables

scopevar.name: CurrentRow
scopevar.help: Current row of query that cfoutput is processing.

scopevar.name: RecordCount
scopevar.help: Number of records (rows) returned from the query.

scopevar.name: ColumnList
scopevar.help: Comma-separated list of the query columns.

scope.help: ColdFusion product release information. Comma seperated list of build numbers, first number is the major build number. Example: 7,0,1,116466
ColdFusion product level information, for example: "Professional", "Enterprise", or "Developer"
Locales supported by ColdFusion, comma seperated.
Directory ColdFusion is installed to Example: C:\CFusionMX7
Name of J2EE Application server, for stand-alone ColdFusion the value is "JRun4".
Type of installation method. Example: Native Windows
Information about the host operating system.
The computer architecture, Windows computers are: x86
Build number of the host operating system.
Name of the application set with the cfapplication tag, or in Application.cfc
The application name. If you do not set this variable, or set it to the empty string, your CFC applies to the unnamed application scope, which is the ColdFusion MX J2EE servlet context.
